tool.name: MSSimulator
tool.description: A highly configurable simulator for mass spectrometry experiments.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && mkdir ${' '.join(["'in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out && #end if #if "out_pm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_pm && #end if #if "out_fm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_fm && #end if #if "out_cm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_cm && #end if #if "out_lcm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_lcm && #end if #if "out_cntm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_cntm && #end if #if "out_id_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_id && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if "out_pm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_pm 'out_pm/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if "out_fm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_fm 'out_fm/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #end if #if "out_cm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_cm 'out_cm/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' #end if #if "out_lcm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_lcm 'out_lcm/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' #end if #if "out_cntm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_cntm 'out_cntm/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #end if #if "out_id_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_id 'out_id/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #end if #if "out_pm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_pm/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out_pm' #end if #if "out_fm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_fm/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out_fm' #end if #if "out_cm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_cm/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' '$out_cm' #end if #if "out_lcm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_lcm/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' '$out_lcm' #end if #if "out_cntm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_cntm/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out_cntm' #end if #if "out_id_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_id/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out_id' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input protein sequences
param.help: select fasta data sets(s)

param.name: enzyme
param.label: Enzyme to use for digestion (select 'no cleavage' to skip digestion)

param.name: model
param.label: The cleavage model to use for digestion
param.help: 'Trained' is based on a log likelihood model (see DOI:10.1021/pr060507u)

param.name: min_peptide_length
param.label: Minimum peptide length after digestion (shorter ones will be discarded)

param.name: threshold
param.label: Model threshold for calling a cleavage
param.help: Higher values increase the number of cleavages. -2 will give no cleavages, +4 almost full cleavage

param.name: missed_cleavages
param.label: Maximum number of missed cleavages considered
param.help: All possible resulting peptides will be created

param.name: rt_column
param.label: Modelling of an RT or CE column

param.name: auto_scale
param.label: Scale predicted RT's/MT's to given 'total_gradient_time'
param.help: If 'true', for CE this means that 'CE:lenght_d', 'CE:length_total', 'CE:voltage' have no influence

param.name: total_gradient_time
param.label: The duration [s] of the gradient

param.name: sampling_rate
param.label: Time interval [s] between consecutive scans

param.name: min
param.label: Start of RT Scan Window [s]

param.name: max
param.label: End of RT Scan Window [s]

section.name: variation
section.title: Random component that simulates technical/biological variation

param.name: feature_stddev
param.label: Standard deviation of shift in retention time [s] from predicted model (applied to every single feature independently)

param.name: affine_offset
param.label: Global offset in retention time [s] from predicted model

param.name: affine_scale
param.label: Global scaling in retention time from predicted model

param.name: distortion
param.label: Distortion of the elution profiles
param.help: Good presets are 0 for a perfect elution profile, 1 for a slightly distorted elution profile etc... For trapping instruments (e.g. Orbitrap) distortion should be >4

section.name: width
section.title: Width of the EGH elution shape
section.help: i.e. the sigma^2 parameter, which is computed using 'value' + rnd_cauchy('variance')

param.name: value
param.label: Width of the Exponential Gaussian Hybrid distribution shape of the elution profile
param.help: This does not correspond directly to the width in [s]

param.name: variance
param.label: Random component of the width (set to 0 to disable randomness)
param.help: i.e. scale parameter for the lorentzian variation of the variance (Note: The scale parameter has to be >= 0)

section.name: skewness
section.title: Skewness of the EGH elution shape
section.help: i.e. the tau parameter, which is computed using 'value' + rnd_cauchy('variance')

param.name: value
param.label: Asymmetric component of the EGH
param.help: Higher absolute(!) values lead to more skewness (negative values cause fronting, positive values cause tailing). Tau parameter of the EGH, i.e. time constant of the exponential decay of the Exponential Gaussian Hybrid distribution shape of the elution profile

param.name: variance
param.label: Random component of skewness (set to 0 to disable randomness)
param.help: i.e. scale parameter for the lorentzian variation of the time constant (Note: The scale parameter has to be > 0)

param.name: model_file
param.label: SVM model for retention time prediction

param.name: pH
param.label: pH of buffe

param.name: alpha
param.label: Exponent Alpha used to calculate mobility

param.name: mu_eo
param.label: Electroosmotic flow

param.name: lenght_d
param.label: Length of capillary [cm] from injection site to MS

param.name: length_total
param.label: Total length of capillary [cm]

param.name: voltage
param.label: Voltage applied to capillary

param.name: dt_simulation_on
param.label: Modelling detectibility enabled
param.help: This can serve as a filter to remove peptides which ionize badly, thus reducing peptide count

param.name: min_detect
param.label: Minimum peptide detectability accepted
param.help: Peptides with a lower score will be removed

param.name: dt_model_file
param.label: SVM model for peptide detectability prediction

param.name: ionized_residues
param.label: List of residues (as three letter code) that will be considered during ES ionization
param.help: The N-term is always assumed to carry a charge. This parameter will be ignored during MALDI ionization

param.name: charge_impurity
param.label: List of charged ions that contribute to charge with weight of occurrence (their sum is scaled to 1 internally)
param.help: e.g. ['H:1'] or ['H:0.7' 'Na:0.3'], ['H:4' 'Na:1'] (which internally translates to ['H:0.8' 'Na:0.2']) (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: max_impurity_set_size
param.label: Maximal #combinations of charge impurities allowed (each generating one feature) per charge state
param.help: E.g. assuming charge=3 and this parameter is 2, then we could choose to allow '3H+, 2H+Na+' features (given a certain 'charge_impurity' constraints), but no '3H+, 2H+Na+, 3Na+'

param.name: ionization_probability
param.label: Probability for the binomial distribution of the ESI charge states

param.name: ionization_probabilities
param.label: List of probabilities for different charge states (starting at charge=1, 2, ...) during MALDI ionization (the list must sum up to 1.0)
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: lower_measurement_limit
param.label: Lower m/z detector limit

param.name: upper_measurement_limit
param.label: Upper m/z detector limit

param.name: enabled
param.label: Enable RAW signal simulation
param.help: (select 'false' if you only need feature-maps)

param.name: peak_shape
param.label: Peak Shape used around each isotope peak (be aware that the area under the curve is constant for both types, but the maximal height will differ (~ 2:3 = Lorentz:Gaussian) due to the wider base of the Lorentzian

param.name: value
param.label: Instrument resolution at 400 Th

param.name: type
param.label: How does resolution change with increasing m/z
param.help: QTOFs usually show 'constant' behavior, FTs have linear degradation, and on Orbitraps the resolution decreases with square root of mass

param.name: scaling
param.label: Scale of baseline
param.help: Set to 0 to disable simulation of baseline

param.name: shape
param.label: The baseline is modeled by an exponential probability density function (pdf) with f(x) = shape*e^(- shape*x)

param.name: sampling_points
param.label: Number of raw data points per FWHM of the peak

param.name: file
param.label: Contaminants file with sum formula and absolute RT interval
param.help: See 'OpenMS/examples/simulation/contaminants.txt' for details

section.name: variation
section.title: Random components that simulate biological and technical variations of the simulated data

section.name: mz
section.title: Shifts in mass to charge dimension of the simulated signals

param.name: error_mean
param.label: Average systematic m/z error (in Da)

param.name: error_stddev
param.label: Standard deviation for m/z errors
param.help: Set to 0 to disable simulation of m/z errors

section.name: intensity
section.title: Variations in intensity to model randomness in feature intensity

param.name: scale
param.label: Constant scale factor of the feature intensity
param.help: Set to 1.0 to get the real intensity values provided in the FASTA file

param.name: scale_stddev
param.label: Standard deviation of peak intensity (relative to the scaled peak height)
param.help: Set to 0 to get simple rescaled intensities

section.name: noise
section.title: Parameters modeling noise in mass spectrometry measurements

section.name: shot
section.title: Parameters of Poisson and Exponential for shot noise modeling (set :rate OR :mean = 0 to disable)

param.name: rate
param.label: Poisson rate of shot noise per unit m/z (random peaks in m/z, where the number of peaks per unit m/z follows a Poisson distribution)
param.help: Set this to 0 to disable simulation of shot noise

param.name: intensity_mean
param.label: Shot noise intensity mean (exponentially distributed with given mean)

section.name: white
section.title: Parameters of Gaussian distribution for white noise modeling (set :mean AND :stddev = 0 to disable)
section.help: No new peaks are generated; only intensity of existing ones is changed

param.name: mean
param.label: Mean value of white noise (Gaussian) being added to each *measured* signal intensity

param.name: stddev
param.label: Standard deviation of white noise being added to each *measured* signal intensity

section.name: detector
section.title: Parameters of Gaussian distribution for detector noise modeling (set :mean AND :stddev = 0 to disable)
section.help: If enabled, ALL possible m/z positions (up to sampling frequency of detector) will receive an intensity increase/decrease according to the specified Gaussian intensity distribution (similar to a noisy baseline)

param.name: mean
param.label: Mean intensity value of the detector noise (Gaussian distribution)

param.name: stddev
param.label: Standard deviation of the detector noise (Gaussian distribution)

param.name: status
param.label: Create Tandem-MS scans?

param.name: tandem_mode
param.label: Algorithm to generate the tandem-MS spectra
param.help: 0 - fixed intensities, 1 - SVC prediction (abundant/missing), 2 - SVR prediction of peak intensity .

param.name: svm_model_set_file
param.label: File containing the filenames of SVM Models for different charge variants

param.name: ms2_spectra_per_rt_bin
param.label: Number of allowed MS/MS spectra in a retention time bin

param.name: min_mz_peak_distance
param.label: The minimal distance (in Th) between two peaks for concurrent selection for fragmentation
param.help: Also used to define the m/z width of an exclusion window (distance +/- from m/z of precursor). If you set this lower than the isotopic envelope of a peptide, you might get multiple fragment spectra pointing to the same precursor

param.name: mz_isolation_window
param.label: All peaks within a mass window (in Th) of a selected peak are also selected for fragmentation

param.name: exclude_overlapping_peaks
param.label: If true, overlapping or nearby peaks (within 'min_mz_peak_distance') are excluded for selection

param.name: charge_filter
param.label: Charges considered for MS2 fragmentation
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

expand.name: charge_filter

validator.message: a space separated list of integer values in the range 1:5 is required

expand.validator: len(value.split(' ')) == len([_ for _ in value.split(' ') if 1 <= int(_) <= 5])

param.name: use_dynamic_exclusion
param.label: If true dynamic exclusion is applied

param.name: exclusion_time
param.label: The time (in seconds) a feature is excluded

param.name: max_list_size
param.label: The maximal number of precursors in the inclusion list

param.name: min_rt
param.label: Minimal rt in seconds

param.name: max_rt
param.label: Maximal rt in seconds

param.name: rt_step_size
param.label: rt step size in seconds

param.name: rt_window_size
param.label: rt window size in seconds

param.name: min_protein_id_probability
param.label: Minimal protein probability for a protein to be considered identified

param.name: min_pt_weight
param.label: Minimal pt weight of a precurso

param.name: min_mz
param.label: Minimal mz to be considered in protein based LP formulation

param.name: max_mz
param.label: Minimal mz to be considered in protein based LP formulation

param.name: use_peptide_rule
param.label: Use peptide rule instead of minimal protein id probability

param.name: min_peptide_ids
param.label: If use_peptide_rule is true, this parameter sets the minimal number of peptide ids for a protein id

param.name: min_peptide_probability
param.label: If use_peptide_rule is true, this parameter sets the minimal probability for a peptide to be safely identified

param.name: add_single_spectra
param.label: If true, the MS2 spectra for each peptide signal are included in the output (might be a lot)
param.help: They will have a meta value 'MSE_DebugSpectrum' attached, so they can be filtered out. Native MS_E spectra will have 'MSE_Spectrum' instead

param.name: isotope_model
param.label: Model to use for isotopic peaks ('none' means no isotopic peaks are added, 'coarse' adds isotopic peaks in unit mass distance, 'fine' uses the hyperfine isotopic generator to add accurate isotopic peaks
param.help: Note that adding isotopic peaks is very slow

param.name: max_isotope
param.label: Defines the maximal isotopic peak which is added if 'isotope_model' is 'coarse'

param.name: max_isotope_probability
param.label: Defines the maximal isotopic probability to cover if 'isotope_model' is 'fine'

param.name: add_metainfo
param.label: Adds the type of peaks as metainfo to the peaks, like y8+, [M-H2O+2H]++

param.name: add_losses
param.label: Adds common losses to those ion expect to have them, only water and ammonia loss is considered

param.name: sort_by_position
param.label: Sort output by position

param.name: add_precursor_peaks
param.label: Adds peaks of the unfragmented precursor ion to the spectrum

param.name: add_all_precursor_charges
param.label: Adds precursor peaks with all charges in the given range

param.name: add_abundant_immonium_ions
param.label: Add most abundant immonium ions

param.name: add_first_prefix_ion
param.label: If set to true e.g. b1 ions are added

param.name: add_y_ions
param.label: Add peaks of y-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_b_ions
param.label: Add peaks of b-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_a_ions
param.label: Add peaks of a-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_c_ions
param.label: Add peaks of c-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_x_ions
param.label: Add peaks of x-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_z_ions
param.label: Add peaks of z-ions to the spectrum

param.name: y_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the y-ions

param.name: b_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the b-ions

param.name: a_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the a-ions

param.name: c_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the c-ions

param.name: x_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the x-ions

param.name: z_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the z-ions

param.name: relative_loss_intensity
param.label: Intensity of loss ions, in relation to the intact ion intensity

param.name: precursor_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the precursor peak

param.name: precursor_H2O_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the H2O loss peak of the precurso

param.name: precursor_NH3_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the NH3 loss peak of the precurso

param.name: add_isotopes
param.label: If set to 1 isotope peaks of the product ion peaks are added

param.name: max_isotope
param.label: Defines the maximal isotopic peak which is added, add_isotopes must be set to 1

param.name: add_metainfo
param.label: Adds the type of peaks as metainfo to the peaks, like y8+, [M-H2O+2H]++

param.name: add_first_prefix_ion
param.label: If set to true e.g. b1 ions are added

param.name: hide_y_ions
param.label: Add peaks of y-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_y2_ions
param.label: Add peaks of y-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_b_ions
param.label: Add peaks of b-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_b2_ions
param.label: Add peaks of b-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_a_ions
param.label: Add peaks of a-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_c_ions
param.label: Add peaks of c-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_x_ions
param.label: Add peaks of x-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_z_ions
param.label: Add peaks of z-ions to the spectrum

param.name: hide_losses
param.label: Adds common losses to those ion expect to have them, only water and ammonia loss is considered

param.name: y_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the y-ions

param.name: b_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the b-ions

param.name: a_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the a-ions

param.name: c_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the c-ions

param.name: x_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the x-ions

param.name: z_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the z-ions

param.name: relative_loss_intensity
param.label: Intensity of loss ions, in relation to the intact ion intensity

param.name: ionization_type
param.label: Type of Ionization (MALDI or ESI)

param.name: type
param.label: Select the labeling type you want for your experiment

section.name: ICPL
section.title: ICPL labeling on MS1 level of lysines and n-term (on protein or peptide level) with either two or three channels

param.name: ICPL_fixed_rtshift
param.label: Fixed retention time shift between labeled pairs
param.help: If set to 0.0 only the retention times, computed by the RT model step are used

param.name: label_proteins
param.label: Enables protein-labeling
param.help: (select 'false' if you only need peptide-labeling)

param.name: ICPL_light_channel_label
param.label: UniMod Id of the light channel ICPL label

param.name: ICPL_medium_channel_label
param.label: UniMod Id of the medium channel ICPL label

param.name: ICPL_heavy_channel_label
param.label: UniMod Id of the heavy channel ICPL label

section.name: SILAC
section.title: SILAC labeling on MS1 level with up to 3 channels and custom modifications

param.name: fixed_rtshift
param.label: Fixed retention time shift between labeled peptides
param.help: If set to 0.0 only the retention times computed by the RT model step are used

section.name: medium_channel
section.title: Modifications for the medium SILAC channel

param.name: modification_lysine
param.label: Modification of Lysine in the medium SILAC channel

param.name: modification_arginine
param.label: Modification of Arginine in the medium SILAC channel

section.name: heavy_channel
section.title: Modifications for the heavy SILAC channel
section.help: If you want to use only 2 channels, just leave the Labels as they are and provide only 2 input files

param.name: modification_lysine
param.label: Modification of Lysine in the heavy SILAC channel
param.help: If left empty, two channelSILAC is assumed

param.name: modification_arginine
param.label: Modification of Arginine in the heavy SILAC channel
param.help: If left empty, two-channel SILAC is assumed

section.name: itraq
section.title: iTRAQ labeling on MS2 level with up to 4 (4plex) or 8 (8plex) channels

param.name: iTRAQ
param.label: 4plex or 8plex iTRAQ?

param.name: reporter_mass_shift
param.label: Allowed shift (uniformly distributed - left to right) in Da from the expected position (of

param.name: channel_active_4plex
param.label: Four-plex only: Each channel that was used in the experiment and its description (114-117) in format <channel>:<name
param.help: e.g. "114:myref","115:liver" (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: channel_active_8plex
param.label: Eight-plex only: Each channel that was used in the experiment and its description (113-121) in format <channel>:<name
param.help: e.g. "113:myref","115:liver","118:lung" (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: isotope_correction_values_4plex
param.label: override default values (see Documentation); use the following format: <channel>:<-2Da>/<-1Da>/<+1Da>/<+2Da> ;
param.help: e.g. '114:0/0.3/4/0' , '116:0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: isotope_correction_values_8plex
param.label: override default values (see Documentation); use the following format: <channel>:<-2Da>/<-1Da>/<+1Da>/<+2Da> ;
param.help: e.g. '113:0/0.3/4/0' , '116:0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: Y_contamination
param.label: Efficiency of labeling tyrosine ('Y') residues
param.help: 0=off, 1=full labeling

section.name: o18
section.title: 18O labeling on MS1 level with 2 channels, requiring trypsin digestion

param.name: labeling_efficiency
param.label: Describes the distribution of the labeled peptide over the different states (unlabeled, mono- and di-labeled)

section.name: RandomNumberGenerators
section.title: Parameters for generating the random aspects
section.help: (e.g. noise) in the simulated data. The generation is separated into two parts, the technical part, like noise in the raw signal, and the biological part, like systematic deviations in the predicted retention times

param.name: biological
param.label: Controls the 'biological' randomness of the generated data
param.help: (e.g. systematic effects like deviations in RT). If set to 'random' each experiment will look different. If set to 'reproducible' each experiment will have the same outcome (given that the input data is the same)

param.name: technical
param.label: Controls the 'technical' randomness of the generated data
param.help: (e.g. noise in the raw signal). If set to 'random' each experiment will look different. If set to 'reproducible' each experiment will have the same outcome (given that the input data is the same)

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: out_cm (output: ground-truth features, grouping ESI charge variants of each parent peptide)
out_lcm (output: ground-truth features, grouping labeled variants)
out_cntm (output: ground-truth features caused by contaminants)

data.name: out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_pm
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_pm
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_pm_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_fm
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_fm
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_fm_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_cm
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_cm
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_cm_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_lcm
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_lcm
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_lcm_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_cntm
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_cntm
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_cntm_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_id
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_id
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_id_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
A highly configurable simulator for mass spectrometry experiments.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/UTILS_MSSimulator.html
